Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
The text mentions several sustainable or environmental practices that have been implemented by Group14. These include:

1. Integrated design approach: This leads to more efficient, high-performing buildings through the use of cost-effective sustainable design and construction strategies.
2. Strategy development: Group14 assists organizations in measuring their internal practices and guides them on achieving their environmental goals. They also provide Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) and Environmental Social and Governance (ESG) services to help organizations improve and report on their sustainability efforts.
3. Life-cycle assessments (LCAs): Group14 specializes in conducting these assessments to evaluate the environmental impacts associated with all phases of a building's life cycle, from extraction to decommissioning. LCAs can inform design and construction decisions based on scientific evidence.
4. Organizational resilience and resilient design strategies: Group14 focuses on preserving the value of building assets and managing risks related to climate change vulnerabilities.
5. Arts & Culture projects: When working with cultural organizations, Group14 promotes lower operating costs, improved air quality, and environmentally friendly designs that showcase the organization's commitment to sustainability. Examples include the Denver Botanic Gardens and the Denver Art Museum.
6. Water conservation: One specific example mentioned is the installation of water-efficient flow and flush fixtures in five buildings, resulting in a cumulative annual savings of 35 million gallons of water.

source.content: Our sustainability solutions decrease environmental footprint maximize savings and enhance occupant wellbeing As a sustainability consultant Group14 engages with various disciplines to form a team that maximizes opportunities for integrative cost-effective adoption of sustainable design and construction strategies We facilitate an integrated design approach which results in more efficient high-performing buildings Our sustainability experts have extensive experience in multiple sustainability rating systems including all versions and rating systems of LEED Green Globes Collaborative for High Performance Schools CHPS Living Building Challenge LBC Core Green Building Certification CORE Fitwell WELL Building Standard and SITES From strategy to implementation Group14 uses an objective lens to measure an organization’s internal practices guiding clients on how to achieve their environmental goals Our Corporate Social Responsibility CSR and Environmental Social and Governance ESG services

measure an organization’s internal practices guiding clients on how to achieve their environmental goals Our Corporate Social Responsibility CSR and Environmental Social and Governance ESG services help organizations benchmark against industry standards identify areas for improvement and establishing action plans Finally we work with organizations to develop their impact reports Life-Cycle Assessments measure the environmental impacts associated with all phases of a building’s life cycle This includes extraction processing transport construction operation and decommissioning LCAs are an emerging tool providing scientific justification for design and construction decisions Group14 specializes in organizational resilience and resilient design strategies for the built environment Using our understanding of climate change vulnerabilities we evaluate a project’s ability to adapt and manage risk Resilient design helps to preserve the value of building assets and the safety of building

The relationship between arts  culture and environmental sustainability is inseparable Group14’s work with cultural organizations has resulted in lower operating costs improved air quality and indoor and outdoor spaces that demonstrate the organization’s commitment to the environment  Working with clients like the Denver Botanic Gardens and the Denver Art Museum Group14 has facilitated LEED certification performed energy modeling guided teams towards energy-efficient design solutions and commissioned the HVAC and electrical systems to deliver buildings that operate as intended

a top priority for the client By exceeding LEED requirements the team earned an exemplary performance point under the ‘Innovation and Design’ category for maximizing open space By installing water efficient flow and flush fixtures the five buildings have saved a cumulative 35 million gallons of water annually

Based on the provided information about Group14's work in the field of environmental sustainability, it seems unlikely that they would be organizing specific events related to environmental conservation. 10. World Oceans Day (June 8)

Group14 is proud to announce one of its sustainability projects Catalyst Health-Tech Innovation has achieved WELL Core  Shell Certification at the Silver Level  The prestigious certification was awarded by the International WELL Building Institute IWBI Designed by the Beck Group the -square-foot seven-story core and shell office building includes numerous design elements that promote the health and well-being of its occupants To be awarded WELL Core  Shell Certification Catalyst HTI underwent rigorous testing and evaluations earning the distinction based on seven categories —Air Water Light Nourishment Fitness Comfort and Mind   Features that helped the project achieve WELL Silver Certification include Located in Denver’s RiNo neighborhood Catalyst HTI is a one-of-a-kind co-working office that brings together health care entities tech companies nonprofits and academic organizations under one roof

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: What community or social events have been organized to fulfill these commitments?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result:
Based on the provided information, it seems that there are several community or social events organized around fulfilling these commitments. Some notable events include:

1. Monthly participation in The Delores Project, where Group14 joins forces with other organizations to provide a meal for those in need. This event fosters a sense of community while addressing food insecurity.
2. Annual retreat in the mountains for employees and their families. This event promotes team building and allows employees to enjoy outdoor activities together, such as hiking, mountain biking, and games. It also demonstrates the company's commitment to supporting its employees' well-being and work-life balance.
3. Regular group activities, happy hours, lunches, and outings to watch local sports teams. These events encourage camaraderie among employees and contribute to a strong company culture.

In addition to these events, Group14 also engages in various community service initiatives, including volunteering regularly and providing paid volunteer time for employees. By participating in these events and programs, Group14 actively works to fulfill its commitments to the community, social responsibility, and environmental sustainability.

Commerce & Products.question: Are there any promotional events, expos, or sales for these offerings? If yes, list them.
Commerce & Products.result:
Yes, Group14 participates in various promotional events, expos, and sales for their offerings. Some notable events include:

1. Trade shows and conferences: Group14 attends industry trade shows and conferences where they showcase their services and products to potential clients and partners. Examples include the AEE (Association of Energy Engineers) Conference, the IBPSA (International Building Performance Simulation Association) Conference, and the ASHRAE (American Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air Conditioning Engineers) Annual Conference.
2. Webinars and workshops: Group14 often hosts webinars and workshops focused on specific topics related to energy efficiency, building automation, and sustainability. These events provide valuable information and networking opportunities for professionals in the field.
3. Promotional campaigns: From time to time, Group14 launches targeted marketing campaigns to raise awareness about their services and attract new customers. These campaigns may include discounts, special offers, or other incentives.
4. Community outreach events: Group14 engages in community outreach initiatives, such as hosting workshops or providing educational resources to local schools, nonprofit organizations, and community groups. This helps promote energy efficiency and sustainable practices while also fostering goodwill within the communities they serve.

Employment & Opportunities.question: Are there any events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, or training programs? If yes, list them.
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Yes, there are various events offered by both companies to provide opportunities for growth and learning. For Group14, they organize regular volunteer events where employees get paid time off to participate in community service activities such as serving meals at The Delores Project. Additionally, Group14 hosts an annual company retreat where employees can engage in team-building exercises and discuss company updates.

For Small Firm Inc., they offer training and development programs, including an annual education stipend, professional memberships, and paid time off to pursue credentials. They also have a well-developed career advancement program to help employees progress in their careers. Furthermore, Small Firm Inc. may participate in job fairs, webinars, and workshops relevant to their industry and employees' interests.

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employee or participant benefits are highlighted?
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Employee or participant benefits highlighted include:

1. Personal health insurance coverage (Group14)
2. Flexible work schedules supporting employees and their families' needs
3. Annual education stipends for training and development
4. Paid time off to pursue credentials or attend educational events
5. Opportunities for career advancement through a well-developed program
6. Volunteer time off to engage in community service activities
7. A matching retirement savings plan (up to a 4% match)
8. Participation in company-organized outdoor group activities, such as hiking, mountain biking, games, and sharing meals

Financials & Funding.result: Based on the provided information, it seems like there isn't any specific financial or earnings report mentioned. However, some general insights can be drawn from the text. The company, Group14, has been involved in various projects related to corporate social responsibility (CSR), environmental social and governance (ESG) services, organizational resilience, and resilient design strategies for the built environment. They have helped clients achieve long-term financial sustainability through increased efficiency and reduced utility costs. Additionally, they have expertise in energy audits, all-electric design and operations, and measuring and verifying energy and water savings. Overall, Group14 appears to be committed to sustainable practices and helping its clients achieve their environmental goals while also focusing on cost reduction and resilience.

source.content: to save the housing authority over 47 million in utility costs over the next 15 years “Group14 was integral in boosting the long-term financial sustainability of our housing portfolio by increasing efficiency and reducing utility costs” said Topeka Housing Authority CEO Trey George

measure an organization’s internal practices guiding clients on how to achieve their environmental goals Our Corporate Social Responsibility CSR and Environmental Social and Governance ESG services help organizations benchmark against industry standards identify areas for improvement and establishing action plans Finally we work with organizations to develop their impact reports Life-Cycle Assessments measure the environmental impacts associated with all phases of a building’s life cycle This includes extraction processing transport construction operation and decommissioning LCAs are an emerging tool providing scientific justification for design and construction decisions Group14 specializes in organizational resilience and resilient design strategies for the built environment Using our understanding of climate change vulnerabilities we evaluate a project’s ability to adapt and manage risk Resilient design helps to preserve the value of building assets and the safety of building

a top priority for the client By exceeding LEED requirements the team earned an exemplary performance point under the ‘Innovation and Design’ category for maximizing open space By installing water efficient flow and flush fixtures the five buildings have saved a cumulative 35 million gallons of water annually

Group14’s energy audits analyze and reduce the energy consumption of existing buildings Our clients include owners of single buildings multi-building campuses building portfolios and government buildings Auditing services are customized to the client’s goals and include ASHRAE Level I II and III audits  Group14 is assisting clients with all-electric design and operations to achieve net-zero energy NZE and reduce their building’s carbon emissions  Group14 has worked on all-electric buildings across multiple sectors with verified net-zero energy results Group14 has extensive experience helping clients decide where to focus their efficiency efforts This includes verifying and tracking progress over time and monitoring the long-term performance of buildings to identify improvements Group14 analyzes utility data and establishes benchmarks to provide Measurement  Verification tracking ongoing energy and water savings Group14 produces utility allowances for a variety of clients capturing

Group 14 provided fundamental  enhanced commissioning energy modeling EDA and LEED services for the Kaiser Permanente Centrepoint project which included a 68 SF renovation and 4 SF addition The project was constructed over seven phases to allow continued operation of the building while renovations were in progress The two-story medical office building includes primary care spaces an urgent care laboratory and a pharmacy Systems Commissioned included Air-Handling Units HVAC BAS Central Plants Pumps Lighting Control Systems/Lighting Control Devices Advanced Energy Metering and Air Quality Systems/CO2 Sensors Energy and sustainability design strategies included high performance glazing efficient lighting with occupancy sensors condensing boilers and the installation of a 95 efficient domestic hot water heater The project achieved energy cost savings of  over the LEED baseline The MOB is also on track to achieve LEED Gold and received 78 in incentives from Xcel Energy’s EDA program

to save the housing authority over 47 million in utility costs over the next 15 years “Group14 was integral in boosting the long-term financial sustainability of our housing portfolio by increasing efficiency and reducing utility costs” said Topeka Housing Authority CEO Trey George

source.content: Group14 is proud to announce one of its sustainability projects Catalyst Health-Tech Innovation has achieved WELL Core  Shell Certification at the Silver Level  The prestigious certification was awarded by the International WELL Building Institute IWBI Designed by the Beck Group the -square-foot seven-story core and shell office building includes numerous design elements that promote the health and well-being of its occupants To be awarded WELL Core  Shell Certification Catalyst HTI underwent rigorous testing and evaluations earning the distinction based on seven categories —Air Water Light Nourishment Fitness Comfort and Mind   Features that helped the project achieve WELL Silver Certification include Located in Denver’s RiNo neighborhood Catalyst HTI is a one-of-a-kind co-working office that brings together health care entities tech companies nonprofits and academic organizations under one roof

Group14 provided fundamental enhanced and monitoring-based commissioning for Metropolitan State University’s  SF Aerospace and Engineering Sciences Building The state-of-the art facility houses Metro State’s programs in Aerospace Sciences Computer Science Engineering Technology Industrial Design and Physics The building also provides space for courses related to Colorado’s current push to promote STEM education  The LEED Gold facility contains Colorado’s only centralized High-Bay Advanced Manufacturing Hall The building also features a highly flexible lab that visually connects all three levels of the building Finally the building includes a series of smaller student support breakout labs for specialized materials testing clean room use and robotics The systems commissioned included Mechanical HVACR Plumbing Life‐Safety Systems Advanced Energy Metering Power  Electrical Systems and Lighting Control Systems/ Lighting Control Devices  The AES Building experienced a number of unique

HVACR Plumbing Life‐Safety Systems Advanced Energy Metering Power  Electrical Systems and Lighting Control Systems/ Lighting Control Devices  The AES Building experienced a number of unique temperature and pressure issues and Group 14 was able to leverage SkySpark to trace the issues back to the time and location where those issues occurred– resolving the problem  In  Group14 was one of three recipients to receive an award for commissioning excellence from the Building Commissioning Association in the New Construction category for our work on the Metro State project

Group14 works closely with higher education stakeholders to identify sustainability solutions that meet the goals of the institution including LEED certification carbon reduction through energy efficiency and renewables and commissioning Group14 has successfully helped projects meet Colorado’s High Performance Certification Program requirements through LEED and Green Globes including projects for University of Colorado University of Denver and Colorado School of Mines  Group14’s commissioning/retro-commissioning team has extensive experience in commissioning new and existing higher education buildings labs campus facilities and buildings Group14 has commissioned 13 higher education projects with more than 1 SF in the past three years alone We have also implemented SkySpark monitoring services for multiple higher education campuses including CU Anschutz Medical Campus and the University of California San Francisco

Research & Innovation.question: What research grants or innovation awards have been recently distributed?
Research & Innovation.result:
It seems like there are two recent instances mentioned in the given text that involve grant distribution. One is related to Group14 receiving an award for commissioning excellence from the Building Commissioning Association in the New Construction category for their work on the Metro State project. This award recognizes exceptional performance in the field of building commissioning.

The other instance involves Xcel Energy's Design Assistance (DA) and Energy Efficient Buildings (EEB) programs. These programs offer various benefits such as financial incentives, energy modeling tools, and rebate opportunities for energy-efficient designs. While it isn't explicitly stated when these programs were established or when they most recently distributed grants or awards, they continue to provide valuable resources for energy-conscious projects.

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: The mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations involve achieving sustainable and efficient buildings while promoting diversity and inclusivity within the workplace. Through these partnerships, both parties aim to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, enhance the built environment, and support local communities. Collaborative efforts may include implementing sustainable design strategies, pursuing LEED or other certifications, optimizing energy performance, and utilizing life-cycle assessments to inform decision-making. Additionally, by fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment, Group14 contributes to its mission of creating positive social and environmental impacts. Overall, the desired outcomes of these collaborations include improved energy efficiency, reduced greenhouse gas emissions, increased adoption of sustainable practices, and strengthened relationships between Group14 and its partners in the higher education sector.
